zone.line: the sleeping, the cold, the buried image of
the past. Poetry thus makes immortal
all that which is best, wisest, & most
beautiful in life; the world; it arrests
the vanishing apparitions which haunt
the interlunations of life, & veiling
them in language or in form sends
them forth among mankind bearing
sweet news of kindred joy to those
with whom thier sisters abide —-
abide, because there is no portal of
expression from the caverns of the
spirit which they inhabit into the
universe of things. Poetry redeems
from the decay the visitations of the
divinity in man.
all things
Poetry turns to loveliness: it exalts
the beauty of that which is most
beautiful, & its adds beauty to
that which is most deformed: / grief
it marries exultation & horror
